camel.source.path.channelName.name: camel.source.path.channelName
camel.source.path.channelName.description: The channelName represents a topic that can be subscribed to by the Camel endpoints.

camel.source.endpoint.allowedOrigins.name: camel.source.endpoint.allowedOrigins
camel.source.endpoint.allowedOrigins.description: The origins domain that support to cross, if the crosssOriginFilterOn is true

camel.source.endpoint.baseResource.name: camel.source.endpoint.baseResource
camel.source.endpoint.baseResource.description: The root directory for the web resources or classpath. Use the protocol file: or classpath: depending if you want that the component loads the resource from file system or classpath. Classpath is required for OSGI deployment where the resources are packaged in the jar

camel.source.endpoint.crossOriginFilterO.name: camel.source.endpoint.crossOriginFilterOn
camel.source.endpoint.crossOriginFilterO.description: If true, the server will support for cross-domain filtering

camel.source.endpoint.filterPath.name: camel.source.endpoint.filterPath
camel.source.endpoint.filterPath.description: The filterPath will be used by the CrossOriginFilter, if the crosssOriginFilterOn is true

camel.source.endpoint.interval.name: camel.source.endpoint.interval
camel.source.endpoint.interval.description: The client side poll timeout in milliseconds. How long a client will wait between reconnects

camel.source.endpoint.jsonCommented.name: camel.source.endpoint.jsonCommented
camel.source.endpoint.jsonCommented.description: If true, the server will accept JSON wrapped in a comment and will generate JSON wrapped in a comment. This is a defence against Ajax Hijacking.

camel.source.endpoint.maxInterval.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxInterval
camel.source.endpoint.maxInterval.description: The max client side poll timeout in milliseconds. A client will be removed if a connection is not received in this time.

camel.source.endpoint.multiFrameInterval.name: camel.source.endpoint.multiFrameInterval
camel.source.endpoint.multiFrameInterval.description: The client side poll timeout, if multiple connections are detected from the same browser.

camel.source.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeout
camel.source.endpoint.timeout.description: The server side poll timeout in milliseconds. This is how long the server will hold a reconnect request before responding.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.sessionHeadersEnab.name: camel.source.endpoint.sessionHeadersEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.sessionHeadersEnab.description: Whether to include the server session headers in the Camel message when creating a Camel Message for incoming requests.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.cometds.bridgeErrorHandl.name: camel.component.cometds.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.cometds.bridgeErrorHandl.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.cometds.basicPropertyBin.name: camel.component.cometds.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.cometds.basicPropertyBin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.cometds.extensions.name: camel.component.cometds.extensions
camel.component.cometds.extensions.description: To use a list of custom BayeuxServer.Extension that allows modifying incoming and outgoing requests.

camel.component.cometds.securityPolicy.name: camel.component.cometds.securityPolicy
camel.component.cometds.securityPolicy.description: To use a custom configured SecurityPolicy to control authorization

camel.component.cometds.sslKeyPassword.name: camel.component.cometds.sslKeyPassword
camel.component.cometds.sslKeyPassword.description: The password for the keystore when using SSL.

camel.component.cometds.useGlobalSslCont.name: camel.component.cometds.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.cometds.useGlobalSslCont.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
